scenarioDescription:
The KMT-2016-BLG-0212L Exoplanetary System


Overview

KMT-2016-BLG-0212L is a star with 0.48 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 20547.83 light years away from the solar system.

KMT-2016-BLG-0212L is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the KMT-2016-BLG-0212L system


KMT-2016-BLG-0212L b

KMT-2016-BLG-0212L b was discovered by the KMTNet observatory, in 2018-12, using the microlensing method. Its semi-major axis is 2.20 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of KMT-2016-BLG-0212L b is 5724.000 times the mass of Earth. The radius of KMT-2016-BLG-0212L b is 12.200 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, KMT-2016-BLG-0212L b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system KMT-2016-BLG-0212L, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the KMTNet.
name: KMT-2016-BLG-0212L - System With 1 Exoplanet
